sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an equilateral triangle.
message_1: A math student needs to determine the length of a side in an equilateral triangle with a perimeter of 30 meters. What is the length of each side of the equilateral triangle?
message_2:
To find the length of each side of an equilateral triangle, we need to divide the perimeter by the number of sides. An equilateral triangle has 3 equal sides.

Perimeter = 30 meters
Number of sides = 3

Length of each side = Perimeter / Number of sides = 30 meters / 3 = 10 meters

Each side of the equilateral triangle is 10 meters long.
